chapter.title: Supported Compilers and Platforms
chapter.par: Main development language is ObjectPascal and two main supported compilers are Borland Delphi and Free Pascal. Kylix works too but C++ Builder crashes on internal error. Other Pascal compilers like GPC or TMT were not tested. Supported platforms are now Windows, Linux, FreeBSD (some other Unix systems most probably too), and DOS (and .NET using unmanaged DLL). Imaging was tested on 32bit x86 and 64bit AMD64 (Linux only - no Win64 Pascal compiler now) CPU architectures. It could work on some big endian machines too (except some file format loaders that assume little endian) but I can't test it on any.
Following table contains information about which compilers have been tested and whether Imaging was successfully compiled by them.

chapter.par: If you want use Imaging as external dll/so library you are not restricted only to ObjectPascal but you can use any other programming language which has wrapper to dll/so written. Wrappers for other languages can be found in Source/Wrappers directory. Following tables contain information about which compilers have been tested and whether program using wrapper was successfully compiled by them (for ObjectPascal wrapper look at previous table).
